content:
Please specify the issue.

Let's find out if you can access Trezor Suite.

connections.title: I can access the wallet but there is an issue
connections.description: Something is wrong with the Trezor Suite interface, the balance is not correct etc.

connections.title: I cannot access the wallet at all
connections.description: Trezor Suite says "Connect your Trezor" or "DISCONNECTED"

connections.title: I'm facing an issue with a 3rd party wallet
Firmware update issue
connections.description: Issues related to the firmware update of your Trezor

connections.title: The device is clearly physically broken
Trezor Suite redirect - ETH, ETC, XRP

text: I'm able to access the wallet but...
content: What type of issue are you facing?

connections.title: The balance is not correct
Unconfirmed transaction
There is an unauthorized transaction that I did not make

content: What's application are you using?

connections.title: I am using the desktop application Trezor Suite
I am using the web version at suite.trezor.io/web
Complete balance is gone
connections.description: There is no transaction history available

connections.title: I can see the balance, but it's not correct
connections.description: The transaction history is available but there is a transaction missing, for example

content: Did this issue occur after performing a firmware update?

connections.title: Yes, this happened after a firmware update
No, I did not perform a firmware update recently

content:
Most likely something went wrong during the firmware update and your Trezor got wiped (this is a security feature). There is no need to worry, all you need to do now is run a recovery process using your recovery seed words. You can find a manual on how to recover your wallet by following this link.

Once this is done you should be able to access your wallet with all your coins.

Please, note that if you were using passphrase protection prior to the firmware update then you need to re-enable it in the Settings.

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

content: Do you use passphrase protection? (If you are not sure, learn more about passphrase in our user manual).

connections.title: Yes, I'm using the passphrase protection
No, I'm not using the passphrase protection

content:
It is possible that you did not type the passphrase correctly.


1) Please check all possible variations for a mistype (Passphrase length can be 50 characters max, it is case-sensitive and all ASCII characters count - even an empty space is a character)
2) Make sure that you have set the correct keyboard layout
3) When typing the Passphrase please click on "Show passphrase" so you can see what you're typing

By "mistyping" the passphrase you will create a new wallet. For example, if you choose passphrase "sea", this wallet can be accessed only when "sea" is typed in. If you mistype the word and type for example "see," then you will create a new wallet under passphrase "see" that is different from the one protected by passphrase "sea" (same with "Sea" or "SEE" etc. - Passphrase is case sensitive).

NOTE: Don't use these words, these are just examples.

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

content: Is any transaction marked as "uncofirmed" in your transaction history?

connections.title: Yes, there is at least one unconfirmed transaction
No, all transactions are confirmed

content: The network might be overwhelmed and it may take quite a significant time for a new transaction to be confirmed, especially if a lower fee was set (it can be hours or even days). You just need to wait. Your transaction will be either confirmed or returned to your wallet.
Please clear your browser's cache and refresh the page.

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

content: Is the display lit when the device is plugged in?
metadata: connect trezor to continue, stuck, not recognized

connections.title: Yes, the display is lit
No, the display is dead

content: Is the device recognized by the device manager of your computer?

connections.title: Yes, the device is recognized by the device manager
No, the device is not recognized by the device manager

text: Problem might be with the drivers
content: Try (re)installing the newest Trezor Bridge version from this source (once installed, please proceed by clearing your browser's cache). After successful installation, you should see "trezord" process running in your activity/system/task monitor.

connections.title: Trezor Bridge is running and the device is still not recognized by Trezor Suite

content: Try using a different USB cable or USB port, and make sure that you are connecting your Trezor with the cable directly. Please don't use a USB hub or adapter. Also, if possible, try connecting your Trezor to another computer.

connections.title: This did not help

text: 3rd party wallet does not work properly
content: Can you access your account in the 3rd party wallet?

connections.title: Yes, I can access my account
connections.description: The problem is with my balance, a token etc.

connections.title: No, I can't access my account

content: If you can access your account with the 3rd party wallet, then the Trezor integration seems to be working and the issue is most likely with the given wallet's interface. Please contact their support directly with your inquiry.

Can you access Trezor Suite? 

We need to know whether the issue is with the connection in general or if the issue is related to the given wallet only.

connections.title: No, I cannot access Trezor Suite
Yes, I can access Trezor Suite without any problem

text: What's the problem with the firmware update?

connections.title: I cannot start the firmware update
The whole balance is gone after I performed the firmware update
Trezor stopped working after the firmware update

text: I cannot initiate the firmware update
content: Please see our user manual section regarding the firmware update by following this link.

connections.title: It's still not working

text: I still cannot initiate the firmware update
content: Is there an error message saying that the USB cannot be recognized properly or that there is a problem with USB drivers?

connections.title: Yes, I can see that error message
No, there is no error message displayed

content:
There is a problem with Windows USB drivers failing to recognize Trezor in the bootloader mode.

Please find a manual on how to fix this issue by following this link.
metadata: drivers, windows, usb, not recognized, bootloader

connections.title: This did not help

text: Trezor Suite redirect - ETH, ETC, XRP
content:
Ethereum (ETH), Ethereum Classic (ETC) and Ripple (XRP) are now supported directly through Trezor Suite.

The newest addition to the Trezor artillery brings an improved user interface and experience, unites more coins under one hood and brings new security and privacy features such as Tor, Replace-by-fee, Privacy mode among others.

Trezor Suite is available as a standalone desktop app and through web browser.

The desktop version of Trezor Suite can be downloaded here: https://suite.trezor.io/ 

Trezor Suite browser version can be accessed here: https://suite.trezor.io/web/ 

If you were previously accessing your ETH, ETC and XRP through our Beta and Next wallets, please do not have any concerns as Trezor Suite provides the same level of security with improved performance and new design.

We recommend you download the desktop app of Trezor Suite, to prevent phishing attacks, however, it is possible to use the web version should you have the need for it.
metadata: suite, ethereum, eth, ethereum classic, etc, ripple, xrp

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

text: I am using the web version at suite.trezor.io/web
content: What's Trezor Suite displaying?

connections.title: Stuck at "Connect your Trezor"

text: I am using the desktop application Trezor Suite
content: What's the application Trezor Suite displaying?

connections.title: Stuck at "DISCONNECTED"
